qas.question: Who bought 80% of Vivendi Universal Entertainment in 2004?
What percentage of NBC Universal was owned by Vivendi until 2011?
Who bought 51% of NBC Universal in 2011?
In what month and year did Comcast buy 49% of NBCUniversal?
How much did Comcast pay for 49% of NBCUniversal in 2013?
What percentage did General Electric sell to Vivendi Universal?
Who purchased Vivendi's share of NBCU in 2006?
Who bought 49% of NBCUniversal for $17.6 billion?

context: Burdened with debt, in 2004 Vivendi Universal sold <b5_0>80%<b5_0/> of Vivendi Universal Entertainment (including the studio and theme parks) to <a0_0>General Electric<a0_0/>, parent of NBC. The resulting media super-conglomerate was renamed NBCUniversal, while Universal Studios Inc. remained the name of the production subsidiary. After that deal, GE owned 80% of <b6_0>NBC Universal<b6_0/>; Vivendi held the remaining <a1_0>20%<a1_0/>, with an option to sell its share in 2006. <b7_0>GE<b7_0/> purchased Vivendi's share in NBCU in 2011 and in turn sold 51% of the company to cable provider <a2_0>Comcast<a2_0/>. Comcast merged the former GE subsidiary with its own cable-television programming assets, creating the current NBCUniversal. Following <b8_0>Federal Communications Commission<b8_0/> (FCC) approval, the Comcast-GE deal was closed on Jan 29, 2011. In <a3_0>March 2013<a3_0/>, <b9_0>Comcast<b9_0/> bought the remaining 49% of NBCUniversal for <a4_0>$16.7 billion<a4_0/>.
